column11:
This table presents the Spring 2020 Student Credit Hours (SCH) and Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) enrollments at CCSU, organized by school. It records undergraduate and graduate instruction, applies graduate “extra credit,” and converts totals into standardized FTE enrollments.

By School (Spring 2020):

Liberal Arts & Social Sciences – the largest unit, producing 50,109 total credit hours, equal to 3,205 FTEs.

Business – generated 15,553 credit hours, supporting 935 FTEs.

Education & Professional Studies – contributed 16,280 credit hours, translating into 668 FTEs.

Engineering, Science & Technology – produced 35,507 credit hours, for 2,202 FTEs.

No School – very small, at 430 credit hours and 28 FTEs.

Column meanings:

Undergrad / Graduate Credit Hours – credit hours taught at each level.

Graduate Extra Credit – adjustment giving added weight to graduate courses.

Grand Total Credit Hours – combined load after adjustments.

FTE Undergrad / Graduate / Total – standardized enrollment equivalents (UG SCH ÷ 15, GR SCH ÷ 12).
